TextInput_1: The speedwas faster than I expected and given i'm watching through a screen I didn't feel immersed in the experience, compared with actually being in a vehicle with objects and vehicles around me. The blue color for pedestrians wasn't as easy to recognize as something more alerting such as red/orange for crossing pedestrians.

The turns at round-a-bouts were shaky feeling and it made me slightly nauseous (motion sickness). It was hard to tell when the car was going to turn. Maybe something more like a GPS in the display would be useful. And a voice speaking before it turns.

When the pedestrians and vehicles are shaded blue I don't find this particularly eye-catching. The indicators above people walking also don't feel intuitive. Something more alerting when the AI predicts a person might cross into the street like an exclaimation in yellow. I'm also trying to imagine this in real life, would people need to be shaded blue? Maybe on a radar or display screen of some sort, though even something like green lines that show the way the camera picks up and detects a persons movements (green lines for their arms/legs/body/head) in my opinion would be more useful than shading a person blue or red.

It was difficult to tell the trajectory of the vehicle. I didn't find the visualizations done to other vehicles/pedestrians very useful. I couldn't tell where or when the car would turn. The air bubbles didn't seem to mean much.
